title: Saatvik Green Energy share price lists at₹465 on NSE, same as IPO price
Nifty 50, Sensex on September 26: What to expect in trade today
Japanese stocks on track for 11th straight year of seasonal September outflows
summary: Foreign investors continued their selling spree of Japanese equities for the second consecutive week, totaling 1.75 trillion yen, driven by profit-taking after a record-setting rally. This trend contributes to a potential 11th straight year of net outflows in September. Meanwhile, Japanese investors increased their holdings of foreign long-term bonds, marking the fourth consecutive week of net purchases.

title: Market leadership could emerge from BFSI, metals and auto sector, says Sudip Bandyopadhyay
summary: Indian markets are currently volatile. Metals showed some gains due to copper prices. The Reserve Bank of India policy and Q2 results are key triggers. BFSI sector may lead if the policy is favorable. Construction and infrastructure sectors are also promising. Metals have a long-term positive outlook.

title: Rupee recovers from all-time low, rises 6 paise to 88.70 against US dollar in early trade
summary: The rupee rebounded slightly to 88.70 against the US dollar due to a weaker greenback and hopes for progress in India-US trade negotiations. However, the gains were limited by continuous foreign fund outflows and rising international crude oil prices. Markets are awaiting the RBI's rate decision amid these economic pressures and geopolitical uncertainties.

title: BMW Ventures IPO Day 3: GMP hints at 8% listing pop. Check subscription, price band, other details. Apply or not?
summary: BMW Ventures' IPO, aiming to raise Rs 231.66 crore, experienced a muted response, being only 24% subscribed by the final day. Retail investors showed some interest, while QIBs fully subscribed their portion. Despite the slow subscription, the grey market indicates a potential 8% listing gain. The company intends to use the IPO proceeds for working capital and general corporate purposes.

title: Rs 3 lakh crore lollapalooza to hit India: What this means for consumer demand and stocks
summary: India is set for a consumption boost of Rs 3 lakh crore. GST and income tax cuts, along with RBI's rate reductions, will fuel this surge. Experts predict a 'Lollapalooza effect' impacting consumption-linked sectors. Rural demand is recovering, and urban areas will benefit from tax cuts. Discretionary spending is expected to rise.

title: Sensex drops over 300 pts, Nifty below 24,800 as D-St extends losses to day 6 after Trump slaps fresh tariffs
summary: Indian stock markets declined on Friday, extending losses for the sixth consecutive session, primarily driven by a sell-off in pharmaceutical stocks. This downturn followed U.S. President Donald Trump's announcement of new tariffs, including a 100% levy on branded drugs and 25% on heavy-duty trucks, impacting market sentiment and broader indices.

title: Indian market in consolidation mode; consumption, retail banks to lead next leg of growth: Sushant Bhansali
summary: Ambit Asset Management anticipates Indian stocks may rise. Festive sales and retail loans could boost growth. Corporate earnings are expected to recover. Sushant Bhansali notes current market consolidation. He predicts Q3 earnings will improve. Domestic sectors like autos are favored. Retail banks are well-positioned. Foreign investor interest in India is growing. A strong market is expected by 2026.

title: Seshaasai Technologies IPO allotment likely today. Check status, GMP, refund, listing and other details
summary: Investors await the Seshaasai Technologies IPO share allotment, expected today. Applicants can check their status on the NSE/BSE or MUFG Intime website. Refunds and demat credit are scheduled for September 29, 2025. Listing is set for September 30. The IPO saw strong subscription rates across all investor categories. The company plans to use the funds for expansion and debt reduction.

title: Saatvik Green Energy shares list at 1% discount to IPO price on exchanges
summary: Saatvik Green Energy had a flat listing on the exchanges, debuting at Rs 465 on NSE and slightly lower on BSE. The IPO, which raised Rs 900 crore, was subscribed nearly seven times, driven by institutional investors.

title: GK Energy shares debut at 12% premium over IPO price
summary: GK Energy share price debuted with a premium, listing at Rs 171 on NSE and Rs 165 on BSE against an IPO price of Rs 153, driven by strong investor demand that oversubscribed the Rs 464 crore IPO by 93.6 times.

title: Jaro Education IPO allotment likely today. Check status, GMP, refund, listing and other details
summary: The allotment of shares for Jaro Education’s ₹450 crore IPO is expected to be finalized today. Investors who applied for the issue can check their status online via the BSE, NSE, or registrar Bigshare Services. The shares will be credited to demat accounts by September 29, with listing scheduled on September 30, where the issue is expected to debut at a premium.

title: Nuvama to BEL- Prashanth Tapse of Mehta Equities suggests stocks to buy in the short term
summary: The Indian stock market declined as pharmaceutical shares reacted to Trump's tariff announcement. Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex fell 0.50%, marking six consecutive days of losses. Traders are advised to remain cautious amidst weak momentum and bearish indicators.

title: TCS, Infosys to Wipro: IT stocks slump after Accenture results, Nifty IT dips 7.4% in six days after H-1B visa fee hike
summary: Indian IT companies, including TCS and Infosys, have seen declines for six consecutive days after Accenture's results and rising H-1B visa fees. The Nifty IT index fell 7.4%, costing constituents approximately  ₹1.8 lakh crore in market cap amidst a challenging outlook for the sector.

title: Stocks to buy: Rajesh Palviya of Axis Sec suggests Hindustan Zinc, CreditAccess, Poonawalla Fincorp shares today
summary: The Nifty 50 and Sensex dropped on Friday after President Trump announced a 100% tariff on branded medications. The Nifty 50 declined 0.29% to 24,818.55 and Sensex fell 0.25% to 80,956.01. Investors are advised to monitor support and resistance levels.

title: GK Energy IPO listing: Shares off to decent start, list at 12% premium over issue price
summary: GK Energy IPO listing: GK Energy shares listed at  ₹171 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), a premium of 11.76% over the issue price of  ₹153. On BSE, GK Energy share price listed at  ₹165.20, up 7.97% from the initial public offering (IPO) price.

title: RITES share price jumps over 7% on locomotives supply order worth $18 million
summary: RITES share price rose over 7% after securing an $18-million deal with Talis Logistics for refurbished diesel locomotives in South Africa. The company reported a slight increase in consolidated operating revenue for Q1FY26 and confirmed no related party engagement in the deal.

title: Stocks to buy and sell: From Vedanta to Tata Consumer— Ajit Mishra of Religare Broking picks 3 shares
summary: With the Nifty 50 declining for five straight sessions, Ajit Mishra from Religare Broking identifies key stocks to buy and sell, including Vedanta and Tata Consumer Products, while advising caution for traders in the current market landscape.

title: Jaro Institute IPO: Check step-by-step allotment status, latest GMP, subscription
summary: Jaro Institute's IPO saw strong demand with bidding closing between September 23-25. Allotment status is expected on September 26, and shares will be listed on BSE and NSE on September 30. The IPO raised  ₹450 crore with a subscription rate of 11.51 times.

title: Solarworld Energy Solutions IPO allotment date likely today. GMP, steps to check share allotment status online
summary: Solarworld Energy Solutions IPO allotment date is likely today, 26 September 2025. Investors can check Solarworld Energy Solutions IPO allotment status online through the websites of BSE, NSE and IPO registrar. MUFG Intime India Pvt. Ltd. is the Solarworld Energy Solutions IPO registrar.

title: Stock market today: Trade setup for Nifty 50, Accenture Q4 results to H-1B visa fee concerns; 8 stocks to buy or sell
summary: Stock market news: The Nifty 50 and Sensex continued their downward trend, reflecting investor anxiety over foreign capital outflows and US visa policies. Despite broad selling pressure, analysts suggested several stocks like Bharti Hexacom and SBI as potential buying opportunities amid volatility.

title: GK Energy IPO listing date today. GMP, experts signal debut of shares at a decent premium in stock market today
summary: GK Energy IPO listing date is September 26, Friday, and GK Energy shares will be listed on BSE and NSE. Ahead of the share listing, GK Energy IPO GMP today and experts signal that the stock may list with strong premium in the stock market today.
